title: BodyForce
content:
{
    "title": "BodyForce",
    "description": "",
    "content": "This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.
To submit a bug report on the content, see
https://devforum.roblox.com/c/bug-reports/documentation-issues/72

name: BodyForce
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  Applies a constant force to an object.
description: |
  The BodyForce object applies (or exerts) a force on the assembly to which it
  is parented. If the magnitude of such a force is great enough, assemblies can
  begin to accelerate. The force is determined by the
  Class.BodyForce.Force|Force property, and is defined on the three world
  axes.

  A BodyForce alone cannot apply a torque (it cannot cause the parent to
  rotate on its own). To apply a force at a specific point or apply forces
  relative to the orientation of the assembly, use a Class.BodyThrust instead.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - BodyMover
descendants: []
tags:
  - Deprecated
deprecationmessage: |
  This object is deprecated and should not be used for new work. Use
  Class.VectorForce instead, and see the
  legacy conversion notes.
properties:
  - name: BodyForce.Force
    summary: |
      Determines the force exerted on each axis.
    description: |
      This property determines the magnitude of force exerted on each axis,
      relative to the world.
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Goals
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Physics
  - name: BodyForce.force
    summary: |
      Determines the amount of force applied on each axis.
    description: |
      A deprecated variant of Class.BodyForce.Force that indicates the amount
      of force applied on each axis.
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags:
      - NotReplicated
      - Deprecated
    deprecationmessage: |
      This deprecated property is a variant of Class.BodyForce.Force which
      should be used instead.
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Goals
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: false
    capabilities:
      - Physics
methods: []
events: []
callbacks: []",
    "source": "BodyForce.yaml"
}
